content.question:
A common laboratory investigation involves putting a solution of starch and glucose into a dialysis bag and suspending the bag in a beaker of water, as shown in the figure below.

The investigation is aimed at understanding how molecular size affects movement through a membrane.

Which of the following best represents the amount of starch, water, and glucose in the dialysis bag over the course of the investigation?

choices.label: A graph with x-axis labeled time and y-axis labeled relative amount in dialysis bag.The amount of starch remains constant. The amount of water starts below the amount of starch, increases to above the amount of starch and flattens out. The amount of glucose starts at higher than the amount of the starch, decreases to less than the amount of starch and flattens out.

A graph with x-axis labeled time and y-axis labeled relative amount in dialysis bag. The amount of starch remains constant. The amount of glucose starts below the amount of starch, increases to above the amount of starch and flattens out. The amount of water starts at higher than the amount of the starch, decreases to less than the amount of starch and flattens out.

A graph with x-axis labeled time and y-axis labeled relative amount in dialysis bag. The amount of glucose remains constant. The amount of starch starts far below the amount of glucose, increases to above the amount of glucose and flattens out. The amount of water starts at higher than the amount of the glucose, decreases to far less than the amount of glucose and flattens out.

A graph with x-axis labeled time and y-axis labeled relative amount in dialysis bag. The amount of water remains constant. The amount of starch starts far below the amount of water, increases to above the amount of water and flattens out. The amount of glucose starts at higher than the amount of water, decreases to less than the amount of water and flattens out.

content.answer: A graph with x-axis labeled time and y-axis labeled relative amount in dialysis bag.The amount of starch remains constant. The amount of water starts below the amount of starch, increases to above the amount of starch and flattens out. The amount of glucose starts at higher than the amount of the starch, decreases to less than the amount of starch and flattens out.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
